snippet: In Toronto, hipness has a fear of heights.
abstract: Op-Ed article by editor and author Shawn Micallef observes that many people in Toronto think it is not hip to live in high-rise apartment buildings; suggests that the knee-jerk disdain for condo and apartment living has something to do with the idea that such housing is considered a temporary station on the way to proper home ownership.
lead_paragraph: In Toronto, hipness has a fear of heights.
